1: Then Zophar the Naamathite answered and said,\q
2:
"Should not such a multitude of words be answered?\q Should this man, so full of talk, be believed?
\q
3:
Should your boasting make others remain silent?\q When you mock our teaching, will no one make you feel ashamed?


\q
4:
For you say to God, 'My beliefs are pure,\q I am blameless in your eyes.'
\q
5:
But, oh, that God would speak\q and open his lips against you;
\q
6:
that he would show you the secrets of wisdom!\q For he is great in understanding.
\q Know then that God demands from you less than your iniquity deserves.


\q
7:
Can you understand God by searching for him?\q Can you comprehend the Almighty perfectly?
\q
8:
The matter is as high as heaven; what can you do?\q It is deeper than Sheol; what can you know?
\q
9:
Its measure is longer than the earth,\q and wider than the sea.


\q
10:
If he passes through and shuts anyone up,\q if he calls anyone to judgment, then who can stop him?
\q
11:
For he knows false people;\q when he sees iniquity, does he not notice it?
\q
12:
But foolish people have no understanding;\q they will get it when a wild donkey gives birth to a man.


\q
13:
But suppose that you had set your heart right\q and had reached out with your hands toward God;
\q
14:
suppose that iniquity were in your hand, but that then you put it far away from you,\q and did not let unrighteousness live in your tents.


\q
15:
Then you would certainly lift up your face without a sign of shame;\q indeed, you would be steadfast and would not fear.
\q
16:
You would forget your misery;\q you would remember it only like waters that have flowed away.
\q
17:
Your life would be brighter than the noonday;\q though there were darkness, it would become like the morning.


\q
18:
You would be secure because there is hope;\q indeed, you would find safety about you and would take your rest in safety.
\q
19:
Also you would lie down in rest, and none would make you afraid;\q indeed, many would seek your favor.


\q
20:
But the eyes of wicked people will fail;\q they will have no way to flee;
\q their only hope will be a last gasp of life."
